request_pathways.name: HIM Department mail (3000 New Bern Avenue, Raleigh, NC 27610)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients download a general-purpose HIPAA authorization PDF, select 'Personal' as the purpose, print and complete by hand, then submit via email, fax, or mail.

red_flags: Fee disclosure is vague — states 'a fee will be charged' for large-volume requests with no schedule, estimate, or reference to HIPAA fee limits
bright_spots: Spanish-language version (N-935S) available alongside English form
Email submission accepted (HIMROI@Wakemed.org) — removes need for fax or mail
Six delivery methods including encrypted email (default) and MyChart
Recently revised form (REV. 11/25) suggests active maintenance

findability.rationale: Level 4: Form found via simple web search and linked from a well-organized HIM page, though one stale URL required browser navigation to locate the current link.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Non-fillable PDF (0 interactive fields) requiring print and handwrite, but fax and email submission are available as electronic submission channels.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with clear section headers, logical flow, and granular record selection; minor clarity issue with 'Personal' purpose label and Recipient field for self-access.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: Generic HIPAA authorization usable for patient access by selecting 'Personal' purpose, but the form was not designed for self-access — Recipient field and third-party framing require patients to adapt.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, multiple submission channels, non-conditioning language present, and proper revocation/re-disclosure disclosures; minor ambiguity in fee disclosure with no specific amounts or HIPAA fee reference.

overall.summary: WakeMed provides a well-organized, accessible ROI form with multiple submission channels and a Spanish translation, but the generic authorization pathway and non-fillable PDF format limit both patient-centeredness and digital accessibility.
